config_description: Enables scripted UDFs (JavaScript UDFs). Java UDFs are always enabled, if enable_user_defined_functions is true. Enable this option to be able to use UDFs with "language javascript" or any custom JSR-223 provider. This option has no effect, if enable_user_defined_functions is false.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions' is checked in the assertUdfsEnabled method to ensure that scripted user-defined functions are enabled in cassandra.yaml. If the configuration is not enabled, an InvalidRequestException is thrown with a message to set enable_scripted_user_defined_functions=true in the configuration file.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions' is triggered whenever the assertUdfsEnabled method is called with a language other than 'java'. This means that the configuration is triggered whenever a user attempts to use scripted user-defined functions in a language other than Java.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Enabling the 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions' configuration option allows users to use scripted UDFs (JavaScript UDFs) and any custom JSR-223 provider. However, it is mentioned that this option has no effect if enable_user_defined_functions is false. Enabling this configuration may introduce security risks, as indicated in the InvalidRequestException message.
